name: fastened
content:

past simple and past participle of
fasten
B1 [ I or T ] to (cause something to) become firmly fixed together, or in position, or closed: Make sure your seat belt is securely fastened. This shirt fastens at the back. fasten something on, together, etc.
B2 to fix one thing to another: I fastened the sticker to the windscreen.
More examplesFewer examplesAre the children safely fastened into their car seats?She fastened her belt tightly around her waist.The door was securely fastened.To keep the helmet in position, fasten the strap beneath the chin.Could you help me fasten this strap around my suitcase?
